cyclone.name: ALEX
cyclone.current_location: about 95 miles north of the western tip of Cuba and 300 miles southwest of Fort Myers, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northeastward, crossing the southern/central Florida Peninsula Saturday then moving into the western Atlantic north of the northwestern Bahamas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the southwest Florida coast in the vicinity of Naples–Fort Myers

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.warning_coast: East coast of Florida south of the Volusia/Brevard County Line to Card Sound Bridge, including Lake Okeechobee
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South and central Florida Peninsula, Florida Keys, and northwestern Bahamas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained 40 mph with higher gusts) are likely Saturday; 60 % chance of ≥34 kt, up to 7 % chance of ≥50 kt.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation of 1–2 ft possible mainly south of the port; significant surge (>3 ft) not expected at the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches possible with locally higher totals, producing flash and urban flooding around Palm Beach County.
weather_observation.other_hazards: A few tornadoes possible across southern Florida peninsula; brief waterspouts could disrupt marine operations.
